intro: Tithymalus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
